alert.note: Alert for Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 9:56PM EST until February 18 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York... Buffalo Creek AT Gardenville affecting Wyoming and Erie Counties. .The following flood warnings are for high flows from rain and snowmelt. Potential ice jams through tonight may result in more significant flooding localized near ice jams. For the Buffalo Creek...including Gardenville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Buffalo Creek AT Gardenville. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Flood stage, minor flooding is possible along the low lying areas next to Buffalo Creek, especially around the farm fields downstream from Union Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EST Thursday the stage was 6.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 7.1 feet around midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage during the early overnight period tonight. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.1 feet on 02/18/2011. - For more information please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 800 AM EST.
